Stem: Branching, cylindrical, fleshy, with long up to 7 cm grey-white spines.
Leaves: Green, fleshy, short lived, up to 12 cm long.
FruitSeeds: Green, oblong, egg or club-shaped, up to 10 cm long. Can grow in a chain of connected fruit.
Habitat: Grasslands, shrublands, roadsides, waterways, open woodlands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Is generally larger and has longer spines than lookalike Cane cactus (*Austrocylindropuntia cylindrica*).
